title.narrative: Narmada Landscape Restoration Project (NLRP)

description.narrative:
NLRP aims to demonstrate the interdependency of enhanced sustainable landscape management practices and improved livelihoods on water resources in the catchment of select Narmada tributaries. The project area of up to 10000 hectares is predominantly forest in the north bank and cropland (agricultural) in the south bank. Specific project interventions will be ascertained after the baseline assessment and factor the contrasting extremes of the mixed landscape continuum of the catchment. The impact of these interventions on water resources will be periodically analyzed to establish the causal effect.
Based on the measured impacts of the project interventions, an incentivization mechanism will be developed, linking local communities and end users like the Indore Municipal Corporation, organic markets and private corporate entities benefitting from the ecosystem services (ES) of the catchment. A scheme design based on this incentivization mechanism will be submitted to the sub-national government. It is anticipated that model could be adopted and replicated across other catchments of Narmada tributaries.
The project seeks to improve quantity and quality of water in select Narmada tributaries through inclusive and sustainable landscape management intervnetions.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04526 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Stakeholders have increased awareness of the importance of ecosystem services and sustainable landscapes management

description.narrative: 1.Baseline assessment report 2.MEL report 3.Sample Survey Reports 4.Final Project Report

title.narrative: Extent to which knowledge products produced and disseminated by GGGI are aligned with the four elements of green growth and have a quality impact, assessed on a 6-point balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 6.
Financial incentives mechanism developed for improving water quality and quantity
Number of completed advisory outputs that inform decisions on green growth investments
Incentivization mechanism for sustainable landscape management practices demonstrated.
Extent to which green growth policies adopted by governments are likely to lead to transformational change. To be assessed on a 4-point scale balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 4.
At least 15 Knowledge products for marking and branding of the project undertaken

description.narrative: Documentation of knowledge products dissemination (press releases, videos, surveys, minutes of meetings, event reports, photos)

title.narrative: Number of knowledge products to improve understanding of green growth and support GGGI operations.

Improved incomes for communities around the tributaries
Improved quality of water resources in select Narmada tributaries
Improved quantity of water in select Narmada tributaries
Local communities apply sustainable landscape management practices in the upland watershed of north and south bank
Number of hectares of biologically significant area showing improved biophysical conditions and natural resource management

Catchment Water Management Plan implemented in select Narmada tributaries
Number and area of demonstration plots created

Market linkage established for at least 2 farmer groups under certification schemes

PIP based on baseline assessments and stakeholder consultations
